briefTitle: Sugammadex vs Placebo to Prevent Residual Neuromuscular Block
officialTitle: Randomized Double---Blinded, Controlled Trial to Compare the Effectiveness of Sugammadex vs. Placebo to Prevent Residual Neuromuscular Block in the Post---Anesthesia Care Unit as Evaluated With a Non---Invasive Respiratory Volume Monitor

protocolDocument.label: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

eligibilityCriteria.criteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Patients undergoing surgery with general anesthesia
* Patients weighing \> or = 80 pounds
* Patients not intubated prior to surgery
* Patients who are able to give informed consent

Exclusion Criteria:

* Patients unable to give informed consent.
* Patients whose condition will not allow for placement of the electrode PadSet of ExSpiron
* Patients who are anticipated to remain intubated in recovery period.

primary.description: The number of subjects who have a MV as defined as \[MV \<80% MV predicted (MVPRED) based on Body Surface Area\]. MV (or respiratory minute volume or minute volume) is the volume of gas inhaled (inhaled minute volume) or exhaled (exhaled minute volume) from a person's lungs per minute.
primary.timeFrame: 15---30 minutes after Post-anesthesia care unit (PACU) arrival

primary.description: The number of subjects who have an average MV \<80% MV predicted (MVPRED) based on Body Surface Area. MV (or respiratory minute volume or minute volume) is the volume of gas inhaled (inhaled minute volume) or exhaled (exhaled minute volume) from a person's lungs per minute.
primary.timeFrame: 15---30 minutes after Post-anesthesia care unit (PACU) arrival

secondary.description: The number of subjects to have a normal TOF ratio (\>0.90) indicative of full neuromuscular recovery in the Post-anesthesia care unit (PACU)
